result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald K Wheeler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bomb Scares, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.015.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: PAY DIRECT TO CLERK OF COURT, ANY BOND APPLIES
Defendant must comply with treatment currently undergoing.
Defendant must continue constructive aspects with veterans and volunteering in the community - try to engage in community at a higher level.  Recommends a budgetary worksheet without micro-managing.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donald K Wheeler

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant, Donald K Wheeler with Attorney Charles S. Huff appeared.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Amidon Nodolf.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(10:04)
State - addresses sentencing - recommends 24 months probation w/held - mental health assess & follow up, complete a budgetary worksheet and perform any other treatment DOC agent requests - pay cc
Huff - argues sentence - submitted for courts review documents of what deft has been doing - 12 months probation is more then enough
Court questions Deft's wife 
Deft's right to allocution - addresses the court - Court questions/addresses deft

COURT:  
w/held sentence 12 months probation
$268 cc
$250 dna surchg
***PAYMENT PLAN***

comply with treatment currently undergoing
recommends a budgetary worksheet but not micro-managing it
continue constructive aspects with veterans and volunteering in the community - try to engage in community at a higher level
